questions.question: What access modifier restricts access to within the class only?
questions.explanation: Private members are only accessible within their defining class.

questions.question: What access modifier allows access from anywhere?
questions.explanation: Public members have no access restrictions.

questions.question: What access modifier allows access in class and subclasses?
questions.explanation: Protected members are accessible in the class and its descendants.

questions.question: What method retrieves the value of a private attribute?
questions.explanation: Getters provide read access to private data.

questions.question: What method modifies the value of a private attribute?
questions.explanation: Setters provide controlled write access to private data.

questions.question: What OOP principle bundles data and methods together?
questions.explanation: Encapsulation combines data and operations into a single unit.

questions.question: What is the practice of hiding implementation details?
questions.explanation: Information hiding restricts access to internal object details.

questions.question: What naming convention in Python indicates a private variable?
questions.explanation: Double underscores trigger name mangling for privacy.

questions.question: What type of method provides read-only access?
questions.explanation: Getters allow reading but not modifying attribute values.

questions.question: What programming principle protects object data from external modification?
questions.explanation: Encapsulation shields internal data from unauthorized changes.
